details: Focus on fruits, vegetables, whole grains, lean proteins
Include vitamins (C, B5, B6, D) and minerals (magnesium, zinc)
Minimize processed foods and excess sugar
Regular moderate exercise with resistance training
Avoid excessive exercise that elevates cortisol
Practice meditation, yoga, and deep breathing to will lower cortisol and support hormone balance
7-9 hours nightly for adrenal health
Essential for optimal hormone production
Limit endocrine-disrupting chemicals
Choose natural personal care products
Limit screen time and schedule regular relaxation
If FSH and LH levels are within normal range, continue monitoring annually
If FSH is between 20–50 IU/L and LH is between 15–50 IU/L, continue to monitor regularly
If a menopausal woman is taking estradiol (E2) and her E2 level is <250 pmol/L, adjust her dose:
Oral estradiol: Increase by 0.25 mg daily
Topical (cream) estradiol: Increase by 0.5 mg daily
Side effects may include breast tenderness, nausea, headache, bloating, mood swings, spotting
Other side effects like weight changes, fluid retention, or discharge follow below:
Reduce the dose by 0.5 mg, or stop estradiol supplementation
If bleeding or spotting occurs, order a pelvic ultrasound to assess endometrial thickness (should be <5 mm)
If no pathology is found, restart estradiol at a lower dose (e.g., 0.25 mg daily, or even 0.125 mg if needed)
Continue to monitor every 3 months until optimal levels are achieved without side effects
Increase Micronized Progesterone Immediate Release (IR) by 50 mg daily, and reassess in 3 months
If patient report side effects like morning drowsiness or breast fullness
Reduce dose by 50%, or
Take P4 --2 to 3 hours before bedtime for 1 week — morning drowsiness should improve, or
Switch from oral IR to sublingual (SL) form at the same dose
Continue with the same dose, reassess in 3 months
If patient is taking DHEA IR/SR, increase oral dose by 5 mg
If report side effects like acne, nipple sensitivity, hair loss, or headaches Follow below:
Stop DHEA supplementation until symptoms resolve
Restart at 50% of previous dose, every other day for 3–4 weeks
If well tolerated, increase to daily, and reassess in 3 months
If patient is using testosterone cream, increase dose by 1 mg, reassess in 3 months
Focus is on optimizing TT levels and monitoring regularly
If report side effects like nipple sensitivity, leg swelling, acne, or excess hair growth follow below:
Stop testosterone supplementation until symptoms resolve
Restart at 50% lower dose, every other day for 3–4 weeks
If no side effects, increase to daily use, reassess in 3 months

Alternatively, add Adreset by Metagenics, taking 2 capsules twice daily

Consider increasing Ashwagandha 500 mg to three times daily
